pyntacle.algorithms.sparseness module¶

this module implements several implementations of a sparseness index as proposed by two publications

class Sparseness(graph)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes the completeness index of a graph or subgraph according to two different theories proposed

compactness(recalculate=False)[source]¶

We implement here the compactness index as described by Randìc and DeAlba (J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci., 1999)

Parameters:recalculate – boolean; whether to recalculate the index or not for the whole graph
Returns:The compactness value for the whole graph
completeness(recalculate=False)[source]¶

We implement the denseness measure as implemented by XXX in Applied Mathematics [EXPAND]

Parameters:recalculate – boolean; whether to recalculate the index or not for the whole graph
Returns:The completeness value for the whole graph
completeness_legacy(recalculate=False)[source]¶

Compute the completeness index as described by Mazza et al for an undirected graph. Completeness is defined as the total number of edges / the total number of nonedges among all possible edges

Parameters:recalculate – boolean; whether to recalculate the index or not for the whole graph
Returns:The completeness index of the graph
get_graph()[source]¶

Returns the graph

Returns:
  • A Graph data structure
logger = None¶

type – Logger

name_to_id(node_name)[source]¶

Retrieves the node index given the node name or index

set_graph(graph, deepcopy=False)[source]¶

Replaces the internal graph object with a new one

Parameters:
  • graph (igraph.Graph) – igraph.Graph object provided in input
  • deepcopy (bool) – Flag determining shallow or deep copy of attributes of the graph
